title: 「代發」迪士尼菲籍員工被捕，員工facebook page已被滅聲！推到迪尼士高層回應！

replies.msg:
代迪士尼員工轉發。

據消息員工常用爆料facebook page已被撿舉至消失！希望連仔幫手關注事件，推到迪士尼高層回應及行動！協助被濫捕嘅菲籍員工！

Subject: Appeal of your declaration and action on your Cast Member Jethro Pioquinto from Hong Kong Disneyland was arrested by Hong Kong Police Force on August 3
Email to: Robert.a.iger@disney.com
Copy to: Stephanie.w.young@disney.com
-----------------------------------------------

Sir Bob Iger

Chairman and Chief Executive Office of The Walt Disney Company

-----------------------------------------------

August 4, 2019

Dear Mr. Iger,

I am a Hong Kong Disneyland Cast Member / former Hong Kong Disneyland Cast Member who wish to bring the following to your kind consideration and necessary action please.

One of your Filipino Cast Member, Jethro Pioquinto, who is currently working at Hong Kong Disneyland was attacked indiscriminately and arrested by the Hong Kong Police Force at Mong Kok, Kowloon, Hong Kong on August 3 evening.

It is primarily confirmed that Jethro Pioquinto (Pioquinto) was passing through the area after his dancing class while the Police Force was making arrests in the area after the clashes and protest. He was wearing a black shirt (which is now being symbolized as what protesters would wear) and on the way home which is believed in the same district.

The Walt Disney Company, who put "Safety" as top service priority, should maintain the safeness of all Guests and Cast Members. Pioquinto, who did not join the protest or clashes on August 3, was attacked indiscriminately by the Hong Kong Police Force and arrested afterwards. Representative from your Public Affairs team of Hong Kong Disneyland has confirmed his identity but no further details provided nor release a statement towards the indiscriminate attack and arrest by the Hong Kong Police Force.

A few requests that I would like your response or actions:
1. follow up with the status of Piopuinto as no updates since he was arrested
2. request of Hong Kong Police Force to release Piopuinto
3. your response on the Hong Kong Police Force regarding their mistakes of arrest and attack towards Piopuinto
4. Provide legal assistance to Piopuinto
5. your action of how to ensure the safeness of all Guests and Cast Members in Hong Kong
6. support the strike on Monday August 5
7. request Hong Kong Government - the largest shareholder of Hong Kong Disneyland to have a proper reply on the captioned issue and how they ensure the safeness of Guests and Cast Members, especially the Cast Members from overseas

Hong Kong Government has been neglected Hong Kong people's request since the no-extradition bill rally in June, 2019. Hong Kong Police Force has started creating a sense of fear instead of protecting the people.

As a Hong Kong Disneyland Cast Member / former Hong Kong Disneyland Cast Member, I am concerned the future of Hong Kong and Hong Kong Disneyland.

Yours sincerely,
A Cast Member from Hong Kong Disneyland / A former Cast Member from Hong Kong Disneyland

-----------------------------------------------

Yours sincerely,
A Cast Member from Hong Kong Disneyland / A former Cast Member from Hong Kong Disneyland
